title: ahash04
author: ahash04
content: Does anyone have any experience about btgg666, i heard its a big scam, they have looted investor's money...

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: I don't even need to do a Google search to know that it's 99.9% likely a scam. No founder in the right mind would name a platform as such as if it was an account username.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: ahash04 on January 15, 2023, 04:58:14 AMDoes anyone have any experience about btgg666, i heard its a big scam, they have looted investor's money...You may like to move this thread to Exchnages.According to mk4, no serious company will get a domain name as what is seen in Op because the name will not sell and also the name is somehow scary In the christiandom there's a believe attached to the number "666"In general, this is not the right time to be looking for new exchanges as if you are looking for new gambling sites with faucet. The exchanges are not having a nice time, go with what you trust.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: KingsDen on January 15, 2023, 06:33:31 AMYou may like to move this thread to Exchnages.I would think, "Reputation" sub-board is more appropriate for it.QuoteIn the christiandom there's a believe attached to the number "666"So, you're also clairvoyant like that? That was the same question I asked one of our late members – Becky666, the first time I interacted with him. That number is ominous, for me. QuoteIn general, this is not the right time to be looking for new exchanges as if you are looking for new gambling sites with faucet. The exchanges are not having a nice time, go with what you trust.Exactly! Why would anyone who wants to choose an exchange not look at the trust rating of the exchange in the first place? I mean, one can easily find that on coin sites like coingecko and CMC. It's an easy thing to do.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: ahash04 on January 15, 2023, 04:58:14 AMDoes anyone have any experience about btgg666, i heard its a big scam, they have looted investor's money...But sincerely OP, with all the good and well-built exchanges out there, why would you choose to use a site poorly built like this? They even displace Huobi's announcement flyer.It's a big scam, and forget about the money you deposited there. Next time, be very vigilant and ask around if you are not sure about the exchange. The domain name alone is a dead giveaway that the site shouldn't be trusted.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Looks like the scammer has run out of reserves of rather premium domain names. It's outrageous for someone to still believe in a platform with a hard to pronounce domain name.Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on January 15, 2023, 10:17:25 AMBut sincerely OP, with all the good and well-built exchanges out there, why would you choose to use a site poorly built like this? Assuming the OP is a newbie who mostly believes that $100k can easily be had in this space, then it's not a new story.

comments.author: Nrcewker
comments.body: Quote from: ahash04 on January 15, 2023, 04:58:14 AMDoes anyone have any experience about btgg666, i heard its a big scam, they have looted investor's money...The exchange name is cringe to be honest. Thank God you haven’t linked the exchange’s link here in the post. Moreover how did you know that they guys have looted the money and that’s from also the investor. And who the hell invests in these type of businesses without any prior verification? If the traders are being scammed, then they are the only ones to be blamed. There are tons of popular exchanges out there, but they still went for these exchanges, so yes scam was in their fate. My condolences are with the scam victims.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: According to the review done by "scamadviser.com" they seemed to be some red flags about the website. Although I didn't bother to check out the website itself I think it will be a waste of time and energy. According to "scamadviser" the owner of the website is not revealing his/her identity and that's what most scam site does. They hide their identity to that when there are through with their scam activity they can disappear into thin air without traces.Quote from: ahash04 on January 15, 2023, 04:58:14 AMDoes anyone have any experience about btgg666, i heard its a big scam, they have looted investor's money...Since you already know that it's a scam site I don't see any reason why you would still be requesting for more information about it. Just go with the fact that it's scam and avoid using it so as to also avoid story that touches the heart.
